p_1: Stitches uses thin typograhy mixed with a custom jittering effect to give the impression of hand-drawn text being animated.
p_3: To achieve the custom jitter, I generated noise & grain in a separate composition with high contrast & low brightness.
p_5: In the main composition, I used an adjustment layer with a displacement map effect where the mapped layer was the noise & grain composition. The jitteriness from the noise & grain was transferred to any layers below the adjustment layer, such as text and graphics.
p_7: The remainder of the typography was either 2D animations with null objects or 3D camera-driven animations. For the 3D camera animations, I placed text layers behind each other and had a camera move into or out of the text.
p_9: To each 3D text layer, I attached a blur filter. As text would get farther from the camera, I animated the blurriness to increase, and the opacity to reduce.
